title.narrative: French Local language Teaching Sept 23 Sep 22

description.narrative: French Local language Teaching Sept 23 Sep 22 2020 MOD Covers the cost of contracts for IT studies, plans, analysis, design and programming, and software maintenance, miscellaneous contractual services for informational technology, and contractual costs of IT systems operation and maintenance. Includes the expenses of contracts related to research and development, market research, maintaining and repairing computers and IT hardware and word processors. Covers the services from the Public Buildings Administration, facility operation, continuing medical education for Peace Corps, security guard services, leasing armored vehicles, Police/Military Guards furnished by host country, post language training, market development agreements, services/supplies/equipment used with physicians/medical staff, and contractual services for immunizations. Also include miscellaneous travel related expensed paid on travel vouchers, contractual services for educators/translators/course instructors, furnishing own supplies, and tuition for training sponsored by FSI, meals/rooms/expenses for offsite FSI trainings.

title.narrative: Preservation of the Cultural Landscape of Koutammakou, the Land of the Batammariba

description.narrative: A remarkable cultural landscape of earthen dwellings and traditional practices straddling the border between Benin and Togo, Koutammakou faces many threats, from rising poverty to loss of biodiversity. This project includes a number of activities to reduce human pressure on the cultural landscape and increase the resources available for conservation.

title.narrative: Documentation of Endangered Cultural Heritage of Dahomey

description.narrative: The Kingdom of Dahomey ruled Abomey from 1600-1900, and even though its palaces are protected heritage, the supporting musical and oral traditions are disappearing as the population urbanizes and its elders die. The project includes the recording, transcription, and broad dissemination of traditional music, dances, and songs.

title.narrative: Preservation of Ethnographic Objects in the Collection of the Cultural Bank of Taneka

description.narrative: Taneka is the home village of the ethnic Yom, who continue to practice many of their ancient customs and traditions. This project involves a suite of preventive conservation measures to safeguard ethnic Yom ceremonial and other ethnographic objects of value to the local community.

title.narrative: Documentation of Endangered Traditional Knowledge of Dahomey

description.narrative: Griots, or storytellers, are important bearers of the history and traditions of the Dahomey region. This project involves the documentation and dissemination of traditional folktales in English and in their original languages to raise awareness and preserve the tales for future generations.
